prompts.name: RepairFlow — Modify Existing File
prompts.description: Edit one existing file. Read whole file, change only requested section, preserve types/imports, output final file contents only.
prompts.body:
You are editing an existing file in the RepairFlow repository. Do NOT create new folders unless explicitly asked. Follow project conventions: Next.js 16 app router, TypeScript, Prisma, NextAuth, Tailwind, Zod, React Hook Form. NEVER invent database fields not defined in prisma/schema.prisma.

Task: <<INSERT TASK DESCRIPTION>>

Before changing code:
- Read the entire file contents.
- Identify the exact sections to change.
- Modify only those sections; preserve other code, imports, types and comments.

Output: Return the final file contents only (no explanation, no diff, no commentary).

prompts.name: RepairFlow — Create Component / Page
prompts.description: Create a new component or page following repo patterns (TSX, Tailwind, Radix, RHF/Zod if form).
prompts.body:
Create a new component/page within the RepairFlow repository.

Rules:
- Place the file under the path: <<INSERT FILE PATH>>
- Use TypeScript functional components. Use Tailwind + Radix UI consistent with existing styles.
- If a form is required: use React Hook Form + Zod and return Zod schema too.
- If fetching data: use server actions or async functions consistent with the app-router.
- Do NOT invent DB fields — reference prisma/schema.prisma for model/field names.

Task: <<INSERT TASK DESCRIPTION>>

Output: Return the new file content only and the file path as a single line at the top (e.g. // FILE: src/...).

prompts.name: RepairFlow — Update Prisma Schema
prompts.description: Make a controlled change to prisma/schema.prisma and include next steps (prisma generate/db push).
prompts.body:
You are editing prisma/schema.prisma for RepairFlow. NEVER rename or delete existing fields or models unless the task explicitly allows it. Maintain naming and relation conventions. If adding fields, set proper types and relation attributes.

Task: <<INSERT SCHEMA CHANGE DESCRIPTION>>

After making changes, append a short 'Run these commands' block showing the exact terminal commands to run (e.g. npx prisma generate && npx prisma db push). Output the updated schema content only.

prompts.name: RepairFlow — Update API Route
prompts.description: Edit an API route in src/app/api — use Prisma, proper error handling and consistent JSON responses.
prompts.body:
Modify an API route inside src/app/api for RepairFlow.

Rules:
- Use Prisma client from project's prisma helper (follow existing import pattern).
- Use async/await and try/catch with clear error responses.
- Keep the route signature unchanged unless instructed.
- Preserve existing TypeScript types and request/response shapes.

Task: <<INSERT TASK DESCRIPTION>>

Output: Return the final file contents only.

prompts.name: RepairFlow — NextAuth Change
prompts.description: Edit NextAuth config; keep session/callback contract and env var usage intact.
prompts.body:
You are updating NextAuth configuration in the RepairFlow repo.

Rules:
- Do not change the session shape unless the task explicitly requires it.
- Use environment variables from .env.example.
- Do not log secrets.

Task: <<INSERT TASK DESCRIPTION>>

Output: Return the updated file content only.

prompts.name: RepairFlow — Full Feature (end-to-end)
prompts.description: Implement a full feature: model (if needed), API routes, server actions, page/component, Zod/RHF where applicable.
prompts.body:
Implement a full feature in RepairFlow.

Requirements:
- If a DB change is needed, modify prisma/schema.prisma (don’t rename/delete existing fields).
- Add API route(s) under src/app/api.
- Add server actions / data fetching consistent with app-router.
- Add front-end page/component(s) with Tailwind and Radix.
- Add Zod schemas and RHF for forms if used.

Task: <<INSERT FEATURE DESCRIPTION>>

Output: Provide all new/modified file paths followed by their final contents. No explanation.
